snippet: Jane’s Walk tours, in honor of the urban critic Jane Jacobs, will take place across New York City this weekend, led by neighborhood residents.
abstract: Municipal Art Society of New York will offer several walking tours across New York City, led by neighborhood residents, to honor the life and work of urban critic Jane Jacobs. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: JANE STREET in the West Village is just a few blocks from where the author and urban critic Jane Jacobs lived, but it's named for the farmer who grew tobacco around there more than two centuries ago. Though Jacobs deserves her own namesake street, she will be getting the next best thing this weekend when the Municipal Art Society hosts nearly 70 free walking tours conducted by neighborhood residents in all five boroughs. The Jane's Walk tours, which began in 2007 in Toronto, her adopted city, and spread to New York last year, will be conducted around the world on Saturday and Sunday to honor the legacy and life of the woman who personified urbanism.

headline.main: Touring the City With Fresh Eyes
